title: Olympia School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Olympia School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Olympia School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Olympia School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Crawford,

Thank you for your email. 

To answer your question regarding excluding public records requests and responsive records made by parents/guardians about their own students. We would agree to exclude records requests made by parents/guardians about their students for their student’s grades and educational file only.

Presumably, virtually an entire students educational file would be exempt from any public records request. 

You reference records from 2012 to 2016 that are paper that need to be scanned to .pdf but also claim the District follows the State of Washington Core Retention Schedule and purges records accordingly.

 If the District follows the Core schedule it would retain no records from 2012 to 2016. Please explain. 

Also please produce records in reverse chronological order, with the newest records to be produced first. 

Thank you.

Thank you for your email.

Respectfully we do not agree to exclude teacher notes, email, or video footage from district school buildings/property and school buses. 

Thank you for clarification on the District’s selective application of the Washington State Core Retention Schedule. 

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Olympia School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Hello,

Please answer my previous questions from 7-13-22.

Printing and scanning emails creates NEW RECORDS, which is completely unacceptable. 

printing and scanning electronic records also does not retain the records NATIVE format which was requested, and does not constitute a "copy" of an electronic record per law.

Please explain in detail your request for $82.79 in fees. Please answer all questions previously asked. Thanks.

communications.subject: questions
communications.communication:
Muckrock requester,

We sent the attached letter to you mid July answering your previous
questions, please confirm that you received it.  Our fee schedule was
detailed to you in our acknowledgement letter and is as follows:

It is policy of the District, to provide paper records for review and to
charge the following for any copies that are requested:

·       $.15 per page for *paper* letter and legal sized documents if more
than 25 pages are provided;

·       $.10 per page for more than 25 pages for *electronic documents
transferred from paper* originals;

·       $.05 per page for every 4 pages of *electronic original documents*
for more than 25 pages.

The charges for the latest installment we notified you about ($82.79),
are calculated at $.05 per page for every 4 pages of electronic original
documents more than 25 pages.

We are producing records in the same way original requests were produced.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.
Regards,

Diana

-- 
*Diana S. Crawford*
*Public Disclosure Officer*
*Olympia School District*
111 Bethel Street
Olympia, WA  98506
360.596.6112-office
360.584.4328-district cell

2nd_installment_responsive_docs.pdf 6.30 MB (29 Pages)

Muckrock_6th_installment_responsive_docs.pdf 2.47 MB (13 Pages)
Muckrock_7th_installment_responsive_docs.pdf 1.58 MB (8 Pages)

These installments appear to be Public Records requests made to your agency, and produced in reverse chronological order. However, no responses to these requests have been included in these installments. Where are the responses? (AS REQUESTED).

When do you anticipate providing a complete record of your agency responses to these public records requests?

Are Installments #1 and #2 inclusive of all public records requests received by your agency in the years 2020 and 2021?

Most of these records appear to be scanned from printed source material.

Printing and scanning emails which exist in electronic form create NEW RECORDS, which is completely unacceptable.

Printing and scanning electronic records also does not retain the records NATIVE format which was requested, and does not constitute a "copy" of an electronic record per law.

Please explain in detail your request for $82.79 in fees. What records production require $82.79 in fees? Certainly not for printing and rescanning electronic emails. 

Also all printed and rescanned emails produced to date that have to be reproduced in electronic form and the fees credited. Please what if any records this applies to. 

Thank you.

communications.subject: Re: Washington Public Records Act Request: Olympia School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Muckrock requester:

Below is the text of the response sent to you in a letter via email last
month mid July.  I also resent the letter via email to you on August 9,
2022.

The $82.79 fee is for the 8th installment of records which is electronic
records billed at $.0125 per page or $.05 per 4 pages as detailed in our
fee schedule provided to you in our letter dated November 15, 2021:
*"it is the policy of the District to charge the following for electronic
copies that are requested:  $.10 per page for electronic documents
transferred from paper originals and $.05 per page for every 4 pages of
electronic original documents."*

Since the requests and records being provided to you in installments #1-7,
and yet-to-be provided pending payment installment #8, are electronic PDFs,
they are billed at the fee detailed above for electronic original documents.

July 19, 2022

PRA Audit

*Muckrock*

120981-94672018@requests.muckrock.com


Dear MuckRock Requester,


Thank you for your email.  We received your email requesting clarification
about our methodology in responding to your public records request.


As we detailed to you in a previous communication, many of our public
records requests concern students and staff. We have approximately 136
public records requests that are responsive to your request that require 3rd
party notification related to hundreds of people.
                                           2020-2021- 28 requests require 3
rd party notification

                                                          2018-2019 – 13
requests require 3rd party notification

                                                          2012-2017 – 95
requests require 3rd party notification



·       With our last installment, we have provided to you, in reverse
chronological order, all requests for records covering 2012-2021 that do
not require 3rd party notification.  Next we will be providing non-exempt
records responsive to those requests.

·       After those installments, we will move on to the requests that
require 3rd party notification, allowing time for affected parties to seek
injunctions if they so choose.  Absent injunctions, we will then provide
non-exempt records responsive to those requests.


Most of our responsive records are available electronically, but many from
2012 – 2017 are in paper form and will need to be scanned into PDFs.
Emails are printed and then scanned to PDF for production.  We are making
steady progress in fulfilling your request but are unable to give an exact
date when the request will be completed in full.


Please let us know if you have any other questions.


Sincerely,




Diana S. Crawford

Public Disclosure Officer
Regards,


Diana

-- 
*Diana S. Crawford*
*Public Disclosure Officer*
*Olympia School District*
111 Bethel Street
Olympia, WA  98506
360.596.6112-office
360.584.4328-district cell

2-23-23

Hello,

I do not understand this statement:

"You will have 30 days to review or request copies of the assembled records once they are available."

I have requested identifiable records to be produced. You continue to slow play, obstruct, and ignore my questions. You also only produce records when repeatedly asked again and again and now submit vague statement like "You will have 30 days to review or request copies of the assembled records once they are available."

I am not going to re-request anything. 

Requestors should not have to beg your office repeatedly for copies of public records.

QUESTION: how many more installments do you expect until this request is complete? When do you expect this request to be complete?

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Carlos Marcello (FBI)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the FBI's files on Carlos Marcello, described by the New York Times as a "Reputed Crime Boss In New Orleans Area"

His death was widely reported, and an obituary is attached.

I request media status, as I am a journalist who writes extensively about FBI files - https://www.muckrock.com/project/subjects-matter-fbi-files-10/, which have received national and international attention - http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3219376/Undercover-FBI-agents-spy-annual-Burning-Man-festival-light-ongoing-war-terrorism-use-test-new-intelligence-collection-technology.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JPat Brown

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Carlos Marcello (FBI)
communications.communication:
Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 134 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 523 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,335 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,875 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: North Carolina DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: North Carolina DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

2) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Elijah Salisbury

communications.subject: New Public Records Request: Elijah Salisbury
communications.communication:
Hi Elijah,
Attached are the policies you request from the North Carolina prison system. The first one is the work release fiscal policy. The section that addresses per diem (room and board) for offenders on work release starts on page .0314. This policy is under review for updating.
The other attachment pertains to offender co-pays for medical services. It also is currently being reviewed for possible revisions.
Here is the information on offender payments for room and board and restitution that you requested for fiscal year 2021:

Category
Offender Cost Amount
Number of Offenders
Per Diem (room & board)
$15,420.00
104
Restitution
$13,149.77
32

This is previously exiting information.
The Department does not have existing reports pertaining to the specific information you requested on the amount of medical co-pays paid by offenders in 2021. As you may be aware, N.C. General Statute § 132-6.2.(e) does not "require a public agency to respond to a request for a copy of a public record by creating or compiling a record that does not exist." As a result, we have no responsive public records to that part of your information request.
This concludes your March 31, 2023 public records request.

communications.subject: RE: Tennessee Public Records Act Request: Tennessee Tech drag event
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Lykins:

Thank you for your December 2, 2022 response to my October 31 request for records under the Tennessee Public Records Act (Tenn. Code Ann. 10-7-503 et seq.). We appreciate your offer to narrow the request. Please see the following revised request: 

Records Requested:

All written and electronic communications of Tennessee Technological University administrators or staff between September 7, 2022, and October 31, 2022, regarding:

1. Tennessee Tech student groups Lambda Gay-Straight Alliance and/or Tech Players; and
2. The August 20, 2022 Drag at the Backdoor event at the Backdoor Playhouse.

Fee waiver request: Please note that this request concerns a matter of public interest. The protection of First Amendment free speech rights at public universities, like Tennessee Tech, is of vital concern to the students, faculty, and administrators of that university, and to the greater academic community and the public at large. This request seeks records regarding Tennessee Tech’s ongoing punishment of students for exercising their First Amendment right to host an expressive campus event. The records are not sought for a commercial or personal interest, but rather for the purpose of providing the public with information concerning civil liberties in higher education.

If a fee waiver is not granted, please apprise me of the estimated cost of fulfilling the request.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

Thanks again.

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (January 2023) (Tacoma Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: ShotSpotter Contract (Sacramento County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the current contract between this department, the city, and ShotSpotter, Inc. This request includes the full ShotSpotter Services Agreement, Standard Terms and Conditions, terms of service (including square miles covered, total cost, and contract beginning and end dates), any reference service level agreements, contract amendments, cure notices, non-disclosure agreements, or other revisions to agreements.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Nicky Barnes
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning or describing Nicky Barnes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Nicky Barnes
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@ic.fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
Record/Information Dissemination Section (RIDS) FBI-Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive, Winchester, VA 22602-4843
Direct: (540) 868-4593
Fax: (540) 868-4391
Questions E-mail: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Unreleased Sadeq Qotbzadeh
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Iranian politician Sadeq Qotbzadeh, also spelled Sadegh Ghotbzadeh (24 February 1936 – 15 September 1982), which were not released as part of request number 1484136-000. His death is widely-known and widely reported, and was even the subject of a February 2020 documentary by BBC Persian; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act.

Qotbzadeh immigrated to the United States in 1959, and attended Georgetown University's Walsh School of Foreign Service from 1959 to 1963. He participated in student protests against the Iranian government, and stormed a party held by Ardeshir Zadehi, then-Iranian ambassador in Washington. Soviet defector Vladimir Kuzichkin later claimed in his 1991 book, Inside the KGB: Myth and Reality, that Qotbzadeh had been an agent of Soviet military intelligence during this time.

Qotbzadeh became a close aides to the Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini, and participated in the overthrow of the Iranian monarchy and the establishment of the Islamic Republic of Iran. He was arrested in April 1982 on charges of plotting a coup d'etat, and was executed in September of that year.

I previously requested records for Qotbzadeh, request number 1484136-000.

In your 29 January 2021 response to that request, you noted that 

As I wrote in my initial 22 December 2020 request, "If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release." However, your 29 January 2021 response letter states that you "consider [the] request fulfilled" after releasing documents from a previous search. As the letter continues, "additional records potentially responsive to your subject may exist," and I "may request an additional search for records."

I am requesting that additional search.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. 

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Holocaust Survey (Schodack Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

By way of background, on August 10, 2022, Governor Kathy Hochul signed into law Chapter 490 of the Laws of 2022 requiring a survey regarding instruction on the Holocaust within New York State public school districts. Through the survey, superintendents are required to attest that the district is teaching about the Holocaust appropriately as part of classroom instruction aligned with the NYS Social Studies Learning Standards and §801 of Education Law.

In October 2022, Deputy Commissioner Angelique Johnson-Dingle sent a memo to public school superintendents including a copy of that survey and instructions for accessing and submitting the survey via the SED Monitoring and Vendor Performance System in the NYSED Business Portal.

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request all of the Holocaust Instruction Survey responses submitted since August 10, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Executive leadership expenses and phone records

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Executive leadership expenses and phone records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

An itemized list of all reimbursed expenses for the Executive Director, Division Director of Accounting, and Division Director of Education from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2022. 
Cell phone records for the Executive Director,  Division Director of Accounting, and Division Director of Education from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Johnny D Fawne.

communications.subject: Open Records Request
communications.communication:
Dear Andre Natta,

I am reaching out to you at this email address as you specified this is your preferred method of contact in your email to the commission. It appears that you are wanting to make an open records request. Please find attached to this email a copy of our Open Records Request Form that can also be found on our website https://arec.alabama.gov/arec/pages/forms.aspx.  Before further reviewing your request, this form will need to be completed and submitted to the commission. Feel free to email a completed copy to me at this email address or to any other method listed on the form.

Thank you.

Serena Cronier | Attorney

communications.subject: RE: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Executive leadership expenses and phone records
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for starting to complete our form on your other request. However, we will need you to fully fill out the 1-page form provided including the section titled “specific documents requested” and “purpose for which information is requested” on both requests.  We will need specific items, date ranges, search terms, etc. and then the purpose related to each. This will ensure governmental efficiency in acquiring and reproducing documents and may reduce the cost to the requestor. Please include proof of Alabama residency as well as the open records act applies only to Alabama citizens. Acceptable forms of proof include a valid Alabama driver’s license, a photo ID license, or any other state or city government issues photo ID that includes your address. Please make sure to completely fill out the form on your other request to ensure efficient response by the commission for that request as well. Thank you for your assistance.

Serena Cronier | Assistant Attorney General
Phone: 334.353.1985 | serena.cronier@arec.alabama.gov<mailto:serena.cronier@arec.alabama.gov>

communications.subject: RE: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Executive leadership expenses and phone records
communications.communication:
Dear Andre Natta,
I am reaching out to you at this email address as you specified this is your preferred method of contact in your email to the commission. It appears that you are wanting to make an open records request. Thank you for completing our provided form and providing proof of Alabama citizenship. In your form you requested “An itemized list of all reimbursed expenses for the Executive Director, Division Director of Accounting, and Division Director of Education from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2022.” I am happy and able to help you with this request. It is my understanding that this information is a matter of public record and readily obtainable by any Alabama citizen. This information can be found on open.alabama.gov. Please let me know if any specific information you are requesting is not available on that website. Additionally, you requested “[c]ell phone records for the Executive Director, Division Director of Accounting, and Division Director of Education from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2022.” The Executive Director, Division Director of Accounting, Division Director of Education, nor any other commission employee has a cell phone provided by the commission so there are no cell phone records to be produced under the open records act in response to your open records request. Let us know if we can be of further assistance.
Thank you.
Serena Cronier | Assistant Attorney General
Phone: 334.353.1985 | serena.cronier@arec.alabama.gov<mailto:serena.cronier@arec.alabama.gov>

communications.subject: RE: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Executive leadership expenses and phone records
communications.communication: The expenses noted on the website you provided are just general categories of reimbursements. My request was for an itemized list.

communications.subject: RE: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Executive leadership expenses and phone records
communications.communication:
Dear Andre Natta,

I am reaching out to you at this email address as you specified this is your preferred method of contact in your email to the commission. In your form you requested “An itemized list of all reimbursed expenses for the Executive Director, Division Director of Accounting, and Division Director of Education from January 1, 2021 to December 31, 2022.” This information can be found on open.alabama.gov. The information listed on the website are the itemized items you are requesting. For example, it may say “lodging – actual expenses,” “meals-actual expenses,” or “mileage”. Those are the break downs of how much was spent on each item based on the amounts allowed by the state for actual reimbursement or on a per diem type basis as is done with meals. There would not be an itemized list for instate travel because you aren’t reimbursed per item, it is on a per diem basis. If there is more information you need, but cannot find on that website, then potentially the Alabama Department of Finance Comptroller’s Office may be able to help you further.

Thank you.


Serena Cronier | Assistant Attorney General
Phone: 334.353.1985 | serena.cronier@arec.alabama.gov<mailto:serena.cronier@arec.alabama.gov>

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Bobs on Sheridan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any incident or investigative reports for false false reports of active shooting or bombings since December 2021.  Reports should include details about an incident in January of 2022 at Bobs on Sheridan. 

Any emails, communications, or bulletins, or internal memos since December 2021 about false reports of active shootings.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all communication between the Council on Environmental Quality and Gina McCarthy between January 28, 2021 and November
25, 2021, in response to Section 208 of Executive Order 14008 of January 27,
2020, entitled “Tackling the Climate Crisis at Home and Abroad,” Fed. Reg. Vol.
86, No. 19.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Daniel Boguslaw

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL] Freedom of Information Act Request: Leasing Communications CEQ--->White House
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Boguslaw ,



     This is to acknowledge receipt of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request[s] that you sent to the Council on Environmental Quality (CEQ). The assigned case number[s] and a summary of your request[s] is below:



1.      FY2022-029 –Any and all communication between CEQ and Gina McCarthy



You have requested special requester status for fee determinations. In order to verify your identity and evaluate this request, please provide a signed copy of this request on your organizational letterhead. For your convenience, you may simply email this to me in a PDF file.



You have requested a fee waiver.  A waiver for fees will be adjudicated if/when fees are applicable.  However, please note that you have not provided any justification for a fee waiver and if I were to adjudicate your request for a fee waiver today, it would not be approved.  To qualify for a fee waiver, you must show why the requested records would significantly contribute to public understanding of government operations.



I am the FOIA Public Liaison and you may contact me with questions regarding your cases. You may also contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) for assistance with FOIA. OGIS may be reached at:



Office of Government Information Services

National Archives and Records Administration

Room 2510

8601 Adelphi Road

College Park, MD 20740-6001



Email: ogis@nara.gov

Phone: 301-837-1996

Fax: 301-837-0348

Toll-free: 1-877-684-6448



Very  Respectfully,

Howard Sun

Attorney Advisor

Council on Environmental Quality

Executive Office of the President

Office: (202) 456-3621

title: Stamford Police Policy To Request FOIA Documents

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Stamford Police Policy To Request FOIA Documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide me in an electronic format, preferable in a PDF file to the email address this message originated from,  the Stamford Police Department's Policy which outlines the Stamford Police Departments policies vis a vis responding to, managing and providing access to public information under the State of Connecticut and Federal Freedom of Information Act.  
Supplementary,  please provide all meeting minutes, applicable notes and documentation which was the basis for the Stamford Police Department's "Freedom of Information request form, 6/20/2019".   

Additionally, all documents and information which details the Stamford Police Department's requirement that the following  data be submitted as a contingency to access FOIA documents:

1)  The requester's home address,  
2) The requesters Cell phone number, 
3) The requesters home and work phone number, 4) The requesters  email address, 
5) The requesters 1st previous home address, 
6) The requesters 2nd previous home address,  
7) The Requesters reason for the request 

Policies pertaining to 

1a) How the data in 1-7 cited above is used to determine whether or not to grant a FOIA request, 
2b) Information concerning the number of requests which were denied based on the data obtained in the "FOI Request Form 6/20/19 between Jan 1, 2000 and March 1, 2023.
3c) information pertaining to how long and in what format the data from all requesters who used the form cited in 2b above between January 1, 2000 to March 1, 2023 stored.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be processed by a representative of the news media/press and made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Meehan

communications.subject: RE: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request #A23-0120
communications.communication:
FILE NO. A23-0120 

Thank you for your response. Unfortunately the City of Stamford has not provided the Documents that were requested. The requested information is as follows:

All documents and information which details the Stamford Police Department's requirement that the following data be submitted as a contingency to access FOIA documents:

1) The requester's home address,
2) The requesters Cell phone number,
3) The requesters home and work phone number, 4) The requesters email address,
5) The requesters 1st previous home address,
6) The requesters 2nd previous home address,
7) The Requesters reason for the request

Policies pertaining to

1a) How the data in 1-7 cited above is used to determine whether or not to grant a FOIA request,
2b) Information concerning the number of requests which were denied based on the data obtained in the "FOI Request Form 6/20/19 between Jan 1, 2000 and March 1, 2023.
3c) Information pertaining to how long and in what format the data from all requesters who used the form cited in 2b above between January 1, 2000 to March 1, 2023 stored.

I appreciate your responsiveness to this request, and look forward to receiving this information within the guidelines of the Federal and Connecticut Freedom of Information laws. 

Thank you.  

Cordially,

Robert Meehan

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: DASD Right to Know Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting a copy of the school districts’ 2021-2022 academic year operating budget as well as the agenda and minutes from the most recent school district board meeting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mike Nonnemaker

communications.subject: RTK Response
communications.communication:
(1)         A DESCRIPTION OF THE RECORD REQUESTED

As Open Records Officer for the district and pursuant to the Right to Know Act, I am in receipt of the Right to Know request received April 14, 2023



(2)          DISTRICT RESPONSE:

                2021 2022 Budget - Link to website:

                                               https://www.dasd.org/departments/business/budget

                Board Meeting Agendas/Minutes:

                                               https://go.boarddocs.com/pa/down/Board.nsf/Public



(3)          THE PROCEDURE TO APPEAL THE DENIAL OF ACCESS UNDER THE ACT

You have the following appeal rights, if you deem this a denial of your request.  You may file an appeal in writing with the Office of Open Records, Commonwealth Keystone Building, 400 North Street, 4th Floor, Harrisburg, PA   17120 as designated under Section 503 of the Act within 15 days of the mailing date of this response or within 15 business days of the deemed denial.  The appeal shall state the grounds upon which you assert that the record is a public record and shall address any grounds stated by this agency for delaying or denying the request.  You may then have further appeal rights under the Act depending upon the decision of the Office of Open Records.



(4) DATE OF THIS RESPONSE:



             April 14, 2023



(5) NAME, TITLE, BUSINESS ADDRESS, BUSINESS TELEPHONE NUMBER OF OPEN RECORDS OFFICER ON WHOSE AUTHORITY THE RESPONSE IS ISSUED:

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- all files, including cross-referenced and ELSUR records, regarding 1960s antiwar activist Rennard Cordon Davis (May 23, 1941 - Feb. 2, 2021), also known as Rennie Davis, a member of the "Chicago Seven." Proof of death is not required, as his death has been widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2021/02/03/us/politics/rennie-davis-dead.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Stuart Christie
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records mentioning the anarchist writer and publisher Stuart Christie (born: 10 July 1946 - died: 15 August 2020). Stuart Christie was jailed in Spain in 1964 for his involvement in a plot to assassinated Francisco Franco. He was released from prison after four years, and was later accused and acquitted of involvement in an organization called "The Angry Brigade" that carried out firebombings against targets such as the US Embassy in London. 

Christie was also a writer of a number of books related to anarchism. He was also an editor of the Soviet-era, English language version of the newsweekly Argumenty i Fakty ("Arguments and Facts") in London. This was a publication that disseminated Soviet propaganda during the final years of the Soviet Union. 

Mr. Christie's 2020 death was widely discussed in the mainstream media and on social media. Please take a look at an obituary from The Guardian newspaper, which should be attached to this request.  

https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2020/aug/17/stuart-christie-obituary

Please include all potentially responsive materials, including but not limited to all communications, reports, inquiries, investigations, photographs, audio files, video files, memos, directives, etc. Please include all materials found in other subject files and all materials associated with any potentially-related names and any other known aliases, nicknames, code names, or any other identifying pseudonyms or references utilized by this agency. Please consult the Central Records System and records, the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Data Management System and records, Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) records, Physical Surveillance (FISUR) records, Technical Surveillance (TESUR) records, and all available cross-reference indices, databases, and records, in addition to any other locations containing potentially-responsive materials related to Stuart Christie.

According to a blog post I just read, it is important that I state the following: "As you know, your agency is required to search the records stored at NARA’s Washington Records Center in Suitland, MD, but still technically under your agency’s control. For more information see 36 CFR 1250.8" Please also conduct a search of records at NARA's Washington Records Center in Suitland, for records related to Stuart Christie.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] - RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI: Stuart Christie
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on “Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request” on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI’s FOIPA Program is searching the FBI’s indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 104 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 853 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,786 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,500 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

COVID-19 Impact: RIDS resumed full staffing on April 12, 2021.  Commensurate with the return of full staffing levels, RIDS will being increasing its FOIA processing production.  While RIDS will make its best efforts to meet increased production goals, this increased production rate may be negatively impacted by COVID-19 workplace disruptions.  As a result, estimated dates of completion for Freedom of Information Act requests were impacted and you can expect lengthened response timelines.  Please note that these are estimates, and these timelines may change as this national emergency evolves.  The FBI remains committed to fulfilling your FOIPA request in the timeliest manner possible.   Thank you for your patience and understanding.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1474829-000

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 2004 Republican National Convention
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated during the 2004 Republican National Convention held in New York City, NY. 

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System (CRS), including but not limited to  the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, and Counterdrug Information Indices System (CIIS) for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This search is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search.

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1561481-000
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 98 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 947 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 2,011 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Liaison Alert System Reports list (2015)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of the Liaison Alert System Reportseither produced or released in 2015. If no such list exists, please provide copies of each alert.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 138 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 571 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,289 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 1,649 days for processing.

Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
F: (540) 868-4391
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: First FOIA (Federal Bureau of Investigation)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

*Documents generated as part of the creation of the FOIA office (defined as whatever department, office, or coordinator is responsible for overseeing and/or processing FOIA requests), whether this was at the time of the agency's creation or the passage of the Freedom of Information Act, to include:
  1. The instruction to do so from the Agency, as well as any guidance from the senior leadership
  2. Documents discussing proposals and procedures
  3. Any legal guidance or analysis produced or acquired by the Agency in response to or as part of the creation of the FOIA office
  4. Internal documents from the press office, legislative liaison's office (or equivalent), general counsel's office (or equivalent), director's office (or equivalent) or the newly created FOIA office, reacting to or characterizing the office and it's creation

* A copy of the agency's first perfected (successful) FOIA request

* Copies of other FOIA requests filed before the FOIA request described above

* Processing notes, search slips and response documents regarding the FOIA requests described above

* The first set of guidelines, instructions and/or forms created to control the agency's processing of FOIA requests

* A copy of the agency's first successful FOIA appeal

* Copies of other FOIA appeals received by the agency before the appeal described above

* Processing notes, search slips and response documents regarding the FOIA appeals described above

* The first set of guidelines, instructions and/or forms created to control the agency's processing of FOIA appeals

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

correspondence will be forthcoming.

FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: Acknowledgement Notice
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Emma Best: 
We received an FBI referral (FBI FOI/PA # 1437546-000) and assigned control GSA-2023-001167. Please refer to this number in all future correspondence concerning this request. Based on this, we anticipate response on or prior to 5/11/2023. 
We have twenty (20) workdays in which to respond (excluding weekends and Federal Holidays).   However, it may not always be possible to provide the documents within this time period. In some cases, we may take an extension and will advise you. Please be advised that your request may be subject to fees for search, review and reproduction costs. Should this be the case, you will be given an estimate of the costs. All estimates are developed in Good Faith and are based on our reasonable judgment. However, due to the unique nature of each request and complexity of documents involved, actual costs to search and review the material may vary. You will be notified of fees, time frames and any other issues prior to and throughout the process. 
Additionally, please be advised that at any time, you can log into the FOIAonline, to access your original request and review the workflow associated with this-tracking number.   Should you have any further questions, feel free to contact this office at our Toll Free Number 1-855-675-FOIA or by email at gsa.foia@gsa.gov to inquire about the status of your request. (mailto:gsa.foia@gsa.gov) 
If you have any concerns regarding the FOIA Requester Service Center, please contact the GSA FOIA Public Liaison, David Eby at (202) 213-2745 or by email at david.eby@gsa.gov. 
Respectfully, 
Freedom of Information Act Requester Service Center 
U.S General Service Administration 
1800 F Street, Northwest (LG) 
Washington, DC 20405 
Toll Free number: (855)-675- FOIA 
Fax number: (202) 501-2727

This letter is in response to your U.S. General Services Administration (GSA) Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request number (GSA-2023-001167), submitted on 04/13/2023, in which you requested the following: 
“To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records: *Documents generated as part of the creation of the FOIA office (defined as whatever department, office, or coordinator is responsible for overseeing and/or processing FOIA requests), whether this was at the time of the agency's creation or the passage of the Freedom of Information Act, to include: 1. The instruction to do so from the Agency, as well as any guidance from the senior leadership 2. Documents discussing proposals and procedures 3. Any legal guidance or analysis produced or acquired by the Agency in response to or as part of the creation of the FOIA office 4. Internal documents from the press office, legislative liaison's office (or equivalent), general counsel's office (or equivalent), director's office (or equivalent) or the newly created FOIA office, reacting to or characterizing the office and it's creation * A copy of the agency's first perfected (successful) FOIA request * Copies of other FOIA requests filed before the FOIA request described above * Processing notes, search slips and response documents regarding the FOIA requests described above * The first set of guidelines, instructions and/or forms created to control the agency's processing of FOIA requests * A copy of the agency's first successful FOIA appeal * Copies of other FOIA appeals received by the agency before the appeal described above * Processing notes, search slips and response documents regarding the FOIA appeals described above * The first set of guidelines, instructions and/or forms created to control the agency's processing of FOIA appeals The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes." 
Please note, upon review of the documents the FBI referred to GSA (FBI FOIA 1437546-000), GSA determined that it was not in our jurisdiction and referred it to the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA). NARA will respond directly to you concerning this FBI referral. 
This completes our action on your request. 
Should you have any further questions, feel free to contact this office at our Toll Free Number 1-855-675-FOIA or by email at gsa.foia@gsa.gov. If you have any concerns regarding the FOIA Requester Service Center, please contact the GSA FOIA Public Liaison, David Eby at (202) 213-2745 or by email at david.eby@gsa.gov. 
We apologize for any inconvenience it may cause you. 
Respectfully,

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: OIS - Firearms Discharges
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) Incident-level data on Edison (NJ) Police Department officers’ drawing their weapons/firearms in the course of their duty: I request data from years 2000 to 2020, including the time, date, and street address (e.g. 123 Main St) for all incidents where an officer drew their weapon/firearm;
2) Incident-level data on the Edison (NJ) Police Department officers’ discharging their weapons/firearms in the course of their duty: I request data from years 2000 to 2020, including the time, date, and street address (e.g. 123 Main St) for all incidents where an officer discharged their firearm;
3) If incident-level data on the Edison (NJ) Police Department officers’ discharging their firearms in the course of duty from years 2000 to 2020 inclusive is available, I also request associated data on whether the shootings by the officers were lethal (i.e. suspects or civilians died as a result of gunshots from officers’ weapons) or were non-lethal (i.e. suspects or civilians were shot but did not die); and
4) Demographic data on the officers and suspects or civilians involved in each incident of Edison (NJ) Police Department officers drawing, discharging, and/or striking (lethal and non-lethal) of suspects or civilians.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Michael Owens

communications.communication:
Good Afternoon,

Edison Police Department
