communications.subject: Public Records Request #R000183-120922
communications.communication:
Good Morning:

The Richland School District received your records request on November 16th.  The District acknowledged the request on November 17th.  At the time, the District believed your request to be from an organization named Muckrock.  As previously explained, the District had received several requests from Muckrock.  As such, the District was answering the requests in the order that they were received.  The District now understands that you are an individual making a public records request through the Muckrock platform.

The District apologizes for the mistake and is prioritizing your request.  You requested the following public records:

1. Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

2. Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

3. Provide complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

I have asked the Student Services Department to provide me with the records that answer the first section of your request. I should have those records in the next ten working days.

As you may know, the Richland School District serves students in the cities of Richland and West Richland.  The District only has School Resource Officers (SRO) in the high schools located in the city of Richland.  I have attached the agreement between the District and Richland Police Department.  This contract has not been finalized. This is the current version of the Agreement.

I am also attaching the agreement that has been in place since 2018.  The District will continue to search for any other records that answer this section of your request.

I understand the third section of your request to be for the work contact information for all safety and security staff, school resource officers and any other employee whose primary job is to provide safety and security services at the District’s school during the 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school years.

To answer this section of your request, I have already made contact with the District’s Human Resources Department to obtain the list of all school security staff for the past three school years and their work locations.  I estimate I will have this information to you in the next ten working days.

To answer this section, the District has the same two SROs from the Richland Police Department for the past several years.  Officer Jason Crouch has been assigned to Richland High School for the past several years.  His work telephone number is 509-967-6561.  The school’s address is 930 Long Avenue, Richland Washington 99352.  His work e-mail address is Jason Crouch RHSSecure@rsd.edu<mailto:RHSSecure@rsd.edu>.

Rick Kane is the SRO assigned to Hanford High School. Hanford High School’s address is 450 Hanford Street, Richland Washington, 99354. His work telephone number is 509-967-6521. Officer Kane’s work e-mail address is Rick Kane HHSSecure@rsd.edu<mailto:HHSSecure@rsd.edu>.

The District did have an SRO at Enterprise Middle School a number of years ago.  West Richland Office Nick Letourneau has not been assigned to the West Richland school for at least two years.  The District is researching the officer’s date of departure.

Again, the District apologizes for the mistake and the delay in getting the responsive records to you. We are prioritizing your request and will be providing you with installments of responsive records.

Please let me know if I misunderstood your request in any way or if you have any questions.

Sincerely,

Galt L. Pettett
Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian
Richland School District #400
6972 Keene Road
West Richland, WA  99353
galt.pettett@rsd.edu<mailto:galt.pettett@rsd.edu>
(509)967-6009





------------------------------------------------------------- NOTICE OF PUBLIC DISCLOSURE: This Richland School District e-mail account is public domain. Any correspondence from or to this e-mail account may be a public record. Accordingly, this e-mail, in whole or in part, may be subject to disclosure pursuant to RCW 42.56, regardless of any claim of confidentiality or privilege asserted by an external party.

As you may know, the Richland School District serves students in the cities of Richland and West Richland.  The District only has School Resource Officers (SRO) in the high schools located in the city of Richland.  I have attached the agreement between the District and Richland Police Department.  This contract has not been finalized. This is the current version of the Agreement. 
I am also attaching the agreement that has been in place since 2018.  The District will continue to search for any other records that answer this section of your request. 
I understand the third section of your request to be for the work contact information for all safety and security staff, school resource officers and any other employee whose primary job is to provide safety and security services at the District’s school during the 2019-2020, 2020-2021, and 2021-2022 school years. 
To answer this section of your request, I have already made contact with the District’s Human Resources Department to obtain the list of all school security staff for the past three school years and their work locations.  I estimate I will have this information to you in the next ten working days. 
To answer this section, the District has the same two SROs from the Richland Police Department for the past several years.  Officer Jason Crouch has been assigned to Richland High School for the past several years.  His work telephone number is 509-967-6561.  The school’s address is 930 Long Avenue, Richland Washington 99352.  His work e-mail address is Jason Crouch RHSSecure@rsd.edu. (mailto:RHSSecure@rsd.edu) 
Rick Kane is the SRO assigned to Hanford High School. Hanford High School’s address is 450 Hanford Street, Richland Washington, 99354. His work telephone number is 509-967-6521. Officer Kane’s work e-mail address is Rick Kane HHSSecure@rsd.edu. (mailto:HHSSecure@rsd.edu) 
The District did have an SRO at Enterprise Middle School a number of years ago.  West Richland Office Nick Letourneau has not been assigned to the West Richland school for at least two years.  The District is researching the officer’s date of departure. 
Again, the District apologizes for the mistake and the delay in getting the responsive records to you. We are prioritizing your request and will be providing you with installments of responsive records. Richland School District has identified and located records responsive to your request.  The first installment to your public records request is now available.  Please log in to the Public Records Request Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive records. Public Records Request - R000183-120922 (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1Har4pEM4U1SR66a9o2fNaoRxQVaj8HzobKcSJOs3LSpRri-2Fuw4R3b1PIgmRHl-2Fsqau1N7ENVYIVIR7FRlxZ9SC6VyMY1hSnDdFIUmP-2FLfrgxVCjm_nnkcKP3DwFpXTku2XB0cVFAdQSrGuF17wunQB84K6tH1h5rzHfvMU8jW0YlmjO9piEq2ZYniMixsxYAGSF5Nrx8CWb7olnzIs-2Bue1e7f7oLyUEX7pMEDrWllLy0l2DfBSruP2wN2t0Cv4hi7uuUht6SbdmQPqKJw0ey57xFc4ar1hKafOhB1qU4dmhZbxyx5tmT-2FqwXQl2SQiOV-2FpaHxwRVf-2Fz-2BKYFDTBO0TOSFnisc-3D) Please let me know if I misunderstood your request in any way or if you have any questions. 
Sincerely,

communications.subject: Public Records Request #R000183-120922 – School Resource Officer Program / School Safety and Security Staff Program / School District Law Enforcement Contracts and Agreements for the Years 2019-2022
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon:

The District has been working to provide you with all responsive records to your recent public records request.  You sought:

A complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

A complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

A complete contact information and email addresses for any and all Safety and security Staff, School Resource officers, Campus Security Officers, contract security personnel, and any other commissioned or noncommissioned employees or contractors whose primary job duty is to provide safety or security services for your agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

To search for, locate, review and produce responsive records, the District has been working with the Human Resources, Student Services and Support Services Departments.

On December 9th the District e-mailed you a copy of the agreement that the District has with the Richland Police Department and West Richland Police Department dated 2018.  The District also e-mailed you the proposed agreement with the Richland Police Department for the 2022-2023 school year.  This second agreement has not been executed by either the District or the police department.

Also on December 9th the District provided you with the name, location, e-mail address, and school telephone numbers for school resource officers who are sworn police officers at Richland High School, Hanford High School, and Enterprise Middle School.

On December 13th, the District provided you with a spread sheet listing the school security staff members from 2019 until 2022.  This spread sheet included the staff members’ names, e-mail addresses, and work location.

On December 21st, the District e-mailed you a copy of the 2021-2022 Safety Staff Data. Since sending you this record, the District has been searching for these reports for the other school years. We will continue to work with the Student Services Department to locate the responsive records.

Attached to this e-mail is a contract the District entered into with a private security firm to provide security at the School District’s school board meetings.  This agreement was entered into in May of 2022.

The District will provide you with the next installment of responsive records in the next seven working days.

Please let me know if you have any questions or if you the District misunderstood your request in any way.
Sincerely,
Galt L. Pettett
Certified Public Records Officer and Records Custodian
Richland School District #400
6972 Keene Road
West Richland, WA  99353
galt.pettett@rsd.edu<mailto:galt.pettett@rsd.edu>
(509)967-6009

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #R000183-120922
communications.communication:
1-17-23

via email to: Galt.pettett@rsd.edu

It is concerning that your district does not know of Engrossed Substitute House Bill (ESHB) 1214 (2021–22) requires that OSPI collect school safety and security staffing data from school districts.

"Data Collection and Reporting: ESHB 1214 includes annual data collection and reporting requirements for all school districts. Data to be collected includes the total number of school safety and security staff in each school building, and descriptions of incidents involving student discipline, use of force against a student, and student arrest by school safety and security staff, all disaggregated by student race, ethnicity, disability status, and other demographics. Districts must also collect data on complaints related to job duties or student interactions by school safety and security staff personnel."

Seems pretty clear. I have requested the information your District is REQUIRED BY LAW to send to OSPI.

Thank you.

Dear MuckRock - SRO, Richland School District received a public information request from you on November 16, 2022 and it is being processed in accordance with Chapter 42.56 RCW, the Washington State Public Records Act. The District assigned your request with the reference number R000183-120922 for tracking purposes.  Please use this number when communicating about your request. You requested the following records: “1. Provide a complete copy of your agency School Safety and Security Data collection report as submitted by your agency to the Office of the Superintendent of Public Instruction (OSPI) for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order. 

2. Provide complete copies of any and all contracts and/or agreements your agency has with any law enforcement organization or agency for the School Years 2022, 2021, 2020, and 2019 in that chronological order.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Emails exchanged between Luis Miranda and Liz Fine or Sandra Rivera since September 1, 2022
2. Emails sent to Liz Fine or Sandra Rivera from email addresses containing @mirramgroup.com since September 1, 2022

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Mellins

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #R000377-011523
communications.communication:
Dear Records Access Officer:

This is an appeal of the office of the governor's determination on 3/15/23, regarding the above request. The office of the governor has constructively denied my request. The possible return date of 4/11/23 -- nearly three months after the request was filed – is unreasonable, given the narrow scope of the request.

Because of this appeal, the office of the governor is required by law to provide specific reasons within 10 business days explaining why this request cannot be filled, or else, must provide the records sought.

According to the Committee on Open Government, if a government entity acknowledges that a request has been received, but has failed to grant access by the specific date given beyond twenty business days, or if the specific date given is unreasonable, a request may be considered to have been constructively denied (see §89[4][a]).  In such a circumstance, the denial may be appealed in accordance with §89(4)(a), which states in relevant part that:

“...any person denied access to a record may within thirty days appeal in writing such denial to the head, chief executive or governing body of the entity, or the person therefore designated by such head, chief executive, or governing body, who shall within ten business days of the receipt of such appeal fully explain in writing to the person requesting the record the reasons for further denial, or provide access to the record sought.” 

I, on behalf of New York Focus, am requesting either you fill this FOIL request, or else provide a full explanation as to the reason for the denial, as required by law, of this public record.

Sincerely,
Sam Mellins
Senior Reporter, New York Focus

title: Holocaust Survey (Locust Valley Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Holocaust Survey (Locust Valley Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

By way of background, on August 10, 2022, Governor Kathy Hochul signed into law Chapter 490 of the Laws of 2022 requiring a survey regarding instruction on the Holocaust within New York State public school districts. Through the survey, superintendents are required to attest that the district is teaching about the Holocaust appropriately as part of classroom instruction aligned with the NYS Social Studies Learning Standards and §801 of Education Law.

In October 2022, Deputy Commissioner Angelique Johnson-Dingle sent a memo to public school superintendents including a copy of that survey and instructions for accessing and submitting the survey via the SED Monitoring and Vendor Performance System in the NYSED Business Portal.

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request all of the Holocaust Instruction Survey responses submitted since August 10, 2022.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker
